citation.title: The American Language

q&a.title: What does "bowl" refer to in "dust bowl"?
q&a.summary:
According to Etymonline the expression dust bowl refers to: 


  
  "drought-plagued region of the U.S. Midwest," first recorded 1936.
  


The following site  www.pbs.org says that the expression  was coined by a  reporter of the Associated Press:
